revised_title: Insect Eye Structures: A Study on Simple, Compound, and Aggregate Eyes
tldr: The author examines the structure and function of simple, compound, and aggregate eyes in insects. They describe the unique features of each type of eye, including the recipient rod cells, facelli, rhabdions, and stemon. The study provides insights into the perception of light and the evolution of insect eyes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Entomology
